•	Employee Relations: Mitigate and/or diffuse any basic employment problems; collaborate with HRM on all employee relations concerns.

Summary I’m interested in applying my knowledge of why and how people engage with and are influenced by education and entertainment content to the development and evaluation of meaningful content. I'm particularly interested in the functional (i.e. goal driven) part of that picture. Whether they realize it or not, audiences pay attention to content that is relevant to their underlying needs and goals. I’m fascinated by the process of uncovering those goals in different contexts and shaping meaningful content so that it engages those critical drivers of how we live our lives. 
 
I’ve managed research, development and evaluation projects for non-profit, government, and academic clients involving the development and evaluation of educational programs and message campaigns to a variety of ends: 
 
-Engagement: Increasing interest and confidence among underserved youth audiences in science education and careers and environmental stewardship 
 
-Behavior Change: Improving the safety of consumer food preparation habits at home 
 
-Attitude Change: Enhancing support for social policies intended to address national obesity rates 
 
-Critical Thinking: Encouraging nanotech scientists to consider the broader potential impacts of their research on the world 
 
Specialties: Quantitative and qualitative social science research, psychology, program evaluation, education, health and risk communication, entertainment media, teaching.
